User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - etc.

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - id: int
     - name: string
     - role: string

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>

3. Director
   - Attributes:
     - scoutingSystem: TeamSportsScoutingSystem

4. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - longList: List<Player>
     - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>

5. Player
   - Attributes:
     - name: string
     - attributes: Map<string, string>

6. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
     - otherAttributes: Map<string, string>

7. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - pros: string
     - cons: string
     - recommendation: string

8. ShortList
   - Attributes:
     - players: List<Player>

9. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - Attributes:
     - headCoach: HeadCoach
     - director: Director
     - headScout: Scout
     - shortList: ShortList
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

10. ScoutingAssignment
    - Attributes:
      - player: Player
      - assignedScout: Scout
      - roundsOfScouting: int
      - completed: boolean

11. Offer
    - Attributes:
      - player: Player
      - offeredBy: Director
      - status: string

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents designated target positions for a player in a player profile.

Classes:
1. Employee(id: int, name: string, role: string): Represents an employee of the sports club with basic information.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(scoutingSystem: TeamSportsScoutingSystem): Represents the director of the club overseeing the scouting system.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting reports.
5. Player(name: string, attributes: Map<string, string>): Represents a player with a name and various attributes.
6. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: Map<string, string>): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: string): Represents a scouting report with player evaluation and recommendation.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players selected for further evaluation.
9. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: HeadCoach, director: Director, headScout: Scout, shortList: ShortList, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the overall scouting system in the sports club.
10. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, assignedScout: Scout, roundsOfScouting: int, completed: boolean): Represents a scouting assignment for a player.
11. Offer(player: Player, offeredBy: Director, status: string): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **TargetPosition**  
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. **PlayerAttribute**  
   - Name
   - Value

3. **ScoutingRecommendation**  
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. **TeamSportsScoutingSystem**
   - Attributes: 
     - headCoach: Employee
     - director: Employee
     - scouts: List<Employee>
     - headScout: Employee
     - shortListedPlayers: List<Player>
   
2. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - position: TargetPosition
     - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>
   
3. **ScoutAssignment**
   - Attributes:
     - scout: Employee
     - player: Player
   
4. **ScoutingReport**
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - pros: String
     - cons: String
     - recommendation: ScoutingRecommendation
   
5. **Employee**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - role: String
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutAssignment>
     - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>

### Attributes:
- **Employee**
  - name: String
  - role: String
  - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutAssignment>
  - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>
  
- **Player**
  - name: String
  - position: TargetPosition
  - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>
  
- **ScoutAssignment**
  - scout: Employee
  - player: Player
  
- **ScoutingReport**
  - player: Player
  - pros: String
  - cons: String
  - recommendation: ScoutingRecommendation

AI:### Enumerations:
1. TargetPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player profile.
2. PlayerAttribute(Name, Value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by name and value.
3. ScoutingRecommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents the recommendations for scouting reports.

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: Employee, director: Employee, scouts: List<Employee>, headScout: Employee, shortListedPlayers: List<Player): Represents the system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Player(name: String, position: TargetPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute): Represents a player with their name, position, and attributes.
3. ScoutAssignment(scout: Employee, player: Player): Represents a scouting assignment assigned to a scout for a player.
4. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: ScoutingRecommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player including pros, cons, and recommendations.
5. Employee(name: String, role: String, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutAssignment>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport): Represents an employee of the club involved in scouting activities.

It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

AI:## Enumerations:
1. **PlayerPosition**
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - etc.

2. **PlayerRecommendation**
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

## Classes:
1. **TeamSportsScoutingSystem**
   - Attributes:
     - List\<Employee> employees
     - List\<Player> designatedPlayerProfiles
     - List\<Player> longListedPlayers
     - List\<Player> shortListedPlayers

2. **Employee**
   - Attributes:
     - String name
     - Role role

3. **HeadCoach**
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Attributes:
     - List\<Player> designatedPlayerProfiles

4. **Director**
   - Inherits: Employee

5. **Scout**
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Attributes:
     - List\<Player> longListedPlayers

6. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - String name
     - PlayerPosition position
     - List\<PlayerAttribute> attributes
     - List\<ScoutingReport> scoutingReports
     - PlayerRecommendation recommendation

7. **PlayerAttribute**
   - Attributes:
     - String attributeName
     - String attributeValue

8. **ScoutingReport**
   - Attributes:
     - String pros
     - String cons
     - PlayerRecommendation recommendation

9. **ScoutingAssignment**
   - Attributes:
     - Player player
     - List\<Scout> assignedScouts

## Note:
- This class model is a high-level representation and may need more refinement based on specific requirements and relationships between classes.

1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents the various designated target positions for a player.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, etc.): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List\<Employee>, designatedPlayerProfiles: List\<Player>, longListedPlayers: List\<Player>, shortListedPlayers: List\<Player>): Represents the overall system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(name: String, role: Role): Represents an employee of the club with a name and role.
3. HeadCoach(name: String, role: Role, designatedPlayerProfiles: List\<Player>): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles.
4. Director(name: String, role: Role): Represents the director of the club.
5. Scout(name: String, role: Role, longListedPlayers: List\<Player>): Represents a scout with a list of long-listed players.
6. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List\<PlayerAttribute>, scoutingReports: List\<ScoutingReport>, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a player with attributes, scouting reports, and recommendation.
7. PlayerAttribute(attributeName: String, attributeValue: String): Represents an attribute of a player with a name and value.
8. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and recommendation.
9. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, assignedScouts: List\<Scout>): Represents a scouting assignment with a player and assigned scouts.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **PlayerPosition**:
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - CB (Center Back)
   - RB (Right Back)
   - CM (Central Midfielder)
   - LW (Left Winger)
   - RW (Right Winger)
   - CF (Center Forward)

2. **PlayerRecommendation**:
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. **Employee**:
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Role

2. **HeadCoach**:
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of designated player profiles)
     - DesignatedTargetPositions (List of PlayerPosition)

3. **Scout**:
   - Attributes:
     - LongList (List of players matching designated target profiles)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of scouting assignments)
   
4. **ScoutingAssignment**:
   - Attributes:
     - Scout
     - Player
     - ScoutingReport

5. **ScoutingReport**:
   - Attributes:
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)

6. **HeadScout**:
   - Attributes:
     - ShortList (List of short-listed players)
     - FirstScoutingResults (Results of first scouting)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of scouting assignments)

7. **Director**:
   - Attributes:
     - OfficialOffer

8. **Player**:
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Attributes (List of player attributes)

### Attributes:
1. **Player Attribute**:
   - Name
   - Value

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition: [Represents various designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.]
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - CB (Center Back)
   - RB (Right Back)
   - CM (Central Midfielder)
   - LW (Left Winger)
   - RW (Right Winger)
   - CF (Center Forward)

2. PlayerRecommendation: [Specifies the different recommendations that can be made for a player after scouting.]
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. Employee(Name: String, Role: String): [Represents an employee in the club with a name and role.]
   
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List, DesignatedTargetPositions: List): [Manages designated player profiles and target positions for scouting.]
   
3. Scout(LongList: List, ScoutingAssignments: List): [Keeps track of players matching target profiles and scouting assignments.]
   
4. ScoutingAssignment(Scout: Scout, Player: Player, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): [Associates a scout with a player and their scouting report.]
   
5. ScoutingReport(Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): [Contains pros, cons, and recommendation for a player after scouting.]
   
6. HeadScout(ShortList: List, FirstScoutingResults: List, ScoutingAssignments: List): [Manages short-listed players, initial scouting results, and scouting assignments.]
   
7. Director(OfficialOffer: Object): [Responsible for making official offers for players.]
   
8. Player(Name: String, Attributes: List): [Represents a player with a name and a list of attributes.]

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the main system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(id: int, name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club involved in the scouting process.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>, designatedTargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition): Represents the head coach responsible for identifying player profiles and target positions.
4. Director(officialOffer: boolean): Represents the director of the club who makes official offers for players.
5. Scout(longList: List<Player>, shortList: List<Player>): Represents a scout who maintains long and short lists of players.
6. Player(id: int, name: String, positions: List<PlayerPosition>, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player being scouted with positions and attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, completed: boolean): Represents a scouting assignment for a scout to investigate a player.
8. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: String): Represents the report submitted by a scout after completing a scouting assignment.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, CB, RB, CM, LM, RM, ST): Represents the various designated target positions for a player as identified by the head coach in the scouting system.
2. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning): Represents the different recommendations that can be made for a player based on scouting evaluations.

Classes:
1. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee in the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(officialOffer: Offer): Represents the director who makes official offers for players recommended for signing.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who notes players matching target profiles and carries out scouting assignments.
5. Player(name: String, value: String): Represents a player attribute identified by a name and a value.
6. ScoutingAssignment(scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment that includes a scouting report about a specific player.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report detailing the pros, cons, and recommendation for a player.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players moved to the short list after initial scouting evaluations.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:

   - Attributes:
     - Role

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of designated player profiles)

3. Director
   - Attributes:
     - OfficialOffer

4. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - LongList (List of players matching designated target profiles)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of scouting assignments)
     - ScoutingReports (List of scouting reports)

5. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - CompletionStatus

6. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation

7. ShortList
   - Attributes:
     - Players (List of short-listed players)

### Attributes:
1. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Value
     - Position (PlayerPosition)

2. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Scout
     - Player
     - CompletionStatus

3. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation

4. ShortList
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - RoundNumber

5. Director
   - Attributes:
     - OfficialOffer

6. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles

7. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - LongList
     - ScoutingAssignments
     - ScoutingReports

Classes:
1. Employee(Role):Represents an employee with a specific role within the club.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles):Manages designated player profiles and identifies target positions for future signings.
3. Director:Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout(LongList, ScoutingReport):Maintains a long list of matching players and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(PlayerPosition, PlayerAttributes, ShortList):Represents a player with their position, attributes, and shortlisted status.
6. ScoutingAssignment(ScoutingRounds):Manages scouting rounds for assigned players.
7. ScoutingRound:Represents a single round of scouting.
8. HeadScout:Represents the head scout responsible for evaluating scouting assignments.
9. Offer(OfficialOffer):Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:Enumerations:
1. TargetPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents designated target positions for players to be scouted.
2. PlayerAttribute (Name, Value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by name and value.
3. Recommendation (KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player after scouting.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: string): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: list): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(OfficialOffer: boolean): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(LongList: list, ScoutingAssignment: object, ScoutingReport: object): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of potential players and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(Pros: string, Cons: string, ShortList: boolean): Represents a player with their pros and cons, and whether they are on the shortlist.
6. ScoutingAssignment(Player: object): Represents a scouting assignment for a specific player.
7. ScoutingReport(Pros: string, Cons: string, Recommendation: string): Represents a scouting report detailing the pros, cons, and recommendation for a player.
